title: Moving charges - particle in E and B-fields

content.question: A particle with charge <math alttext="q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math> and negligible mass is traveling to the right with velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> when it enters a region between two charged plates containing a magnetic field of strength <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> directed into the page, as shown in the figure, and an electric field directed toward the bottom of the page (not shown). The magnitude of the electric field between the plates is <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math>. Which of the following is equal to the net force on the particle as the particle first enters the magnetic field? The positive direction is toward the top of the page.

choices.label: <math alttext="q v B plus q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>q</mi><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="q v B minus q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>q</mi><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="negative q v B plus q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="negative q v B minus q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="q v B minus q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>q</mi><mi>v</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
